title: Functions fmt.Sprint* are hiding warning messages
body:
by **raul.san@sent.com**: 
All functions Sprint* are hiding/masking possible errors when it's expected a type but
is got another one.

***
var char = 'a'
var expChar = fmt.Sprintf("%s", char)
*** 

So they should to throw a panic message (or to return a boolean to indicate if there was
a warning)
